pull_requests.title: Codex Self-Test PR
pull_requests.body: Automated PR created by Codex self-test pipeline.

pull_requests.title: Cleanup/remove legacy codex v2
pull_requests.body:
Sprint 5 Regeneration  Pull Request Template
Title Example

feat: Sprint 5 Regeneration  Workflow Module + Crypto + TypeScript Reintegration

 Summary

This pull request delivers the regenerated Sprint 5 build from the verified Sprint 4 baseline (v4.5.0-baseline).
Key objectives include the new Workflow module, restored TypeScript strict typing, crypto security utilities, and expanded test coverage.

Reference issue: Sprint 5 Regeneration  Workflow Module + TypeScript + Crypto Reintegration

 What Was Added

 Workflow Model + API

Added Workflow model and Prisma migration.

Implemented API routes /api/workflows and /api/workflows/[id].

Updated seed script with sample workflow data.

 TypeScript Strict Mode

Re-enabled tsconfig.json strict rules.

Resolved type errors across API and test layers.

 Crypto Layer

Restored src/lib/crypto.ts for AES-256-GCM encryption/decryption.

Integrated with NEXTAUTH_SECRET.

 Testing

Added Playwright E2E tests for auth, theme toggle, connections, and workflows.

Added integration tests for API routes (Vitest or Jest).

 Docs and Config

Added prisma.config.ts, updated README.md.

Confirmed .env variable usage and security.

 Environment

WSL 2 (Ubuntu 22.04)

Node 22 / npm 10.9.4 ( 11.6.2 optional)

PostgreSQL 15

Prisma 6.17+

Next.js 13 / TypeScript strict mode

Setup reference: doc/WSL_Setup_for_Codex_Rebuild.md

 Verification Checklist
Category	Command / Verification	Status
Build	npm install completes cleanly	
Migrations	npx prisma migrate reset + seed works correctly	
TypeScript	npx tsc --noEmit  0 errors	
Tests	npx playwright test  all pass	
Crypto	crypto.ts encrypts/decrypts sample data	
Manual UI	Workflow CRUD works via browser	
Docs	README.md updated with seed + test instructions	
Lint / Formatting	npm run lint clean	
Tag	v5.0.0-codex-verified created after merge	
 Notes for Reviewers

Database seeding verified for SQLite (dev) and Postgres (local).

All sensitive keys use .env values  no hardcoded secrets.

Workflow logic mirrors Sprint 4 patterns for connections and auth.

 Next Steps

 Approve and merge into main.

 Push tag v5.0.0-codex-verified.

 Close linked issue Codex Sprint 5 Regeneration Request.

End of Template

pull_requests.title: chore: remove legacy Codex dashboard workflow
pull_requests.body:
This PR removes four obsolete GitHub Actions workflows related to the old Codex
dashboard system:

- codex-dashboard-build.yml
- codex-listener.yml
- codex-validation-monitor.yml
- typesript-check.yml

These workflows are no longer used and were replaced by the new Codex integration
pipeline based on `codex/generate.js`.

No application logic or runtime behavior is affected. CI should pass normally.

pull_requests.title: Sprint 5  Harden Codex Validation Monitor & Prepare Pipeline for Full Test Suite
pull_requests.body:
Summary

This PR introduces a hardened and fully-debuggable version of the Codex Validation Monitor workflow.
It ensures Codex validation events are properly recorded, timestamped, surfaced on the dashboard, and committed without being blocked by branch protection rules.

This update also prepares the repo for Sprint 5 testing automation while keeping Sprint 4 stable.

Whats Included
 Improved Codex Workflow

Safer handling of missing client_payload keys.

Validated defaults for status, color, and branch.

Fully rebuilt badge generation (.github/badges/codex-status.json).

Reliable history logging in doc/Codex_Rebuild_History.md.

Automatic syncing of the history snippet into the summary dashboard.

Hardened commit/push logic that respects branch protections.

Added debug echo blocks to trace workflow execution in Actions UI.

 Repository Hygiene

Ensures dashboard/history files auto-create when missing.

Removes old, unused logic from prior iterations.

Centralizes Codex metadata into one workflow.

Why This Matters

Codex orchestrates multi-step CI actions and test suite generation.
Without a hardened monitor workflow:

Codex status badges fail to update

Dashboard never refreshes

History entries are lost

Downstream rebuild triggers break silently

Branch protection rules reject bot commits

This PR fixes all of that.

Testing & Verification

 Workflow syntax validated locally
 GitHub CI confirms YAML correctness
 Runbook tested for Codex  GitHub badge updates
 Dashboard regeneration tested with synthetic payloads
 No impact on runtime app code
 Safe to merge into Sprint 5 branches

Next Steps After Merge

Trigger a Codex validation run

Verify:

Badge updates

History log appends

Dashboard syncs with recent entries

Begin generating the full E2E + integration test suite

pull_requests.title: Sprint 5 testing v2 update
pull_requests.body:
Sprint 5 Regeneration  Pull Request Template
Title Example

feat: Sprint 5 Regeneration  Workflow Module + Crypto + TypeScript Reintegration

 Summary

This pull request delivers the regenerated Sprint 5 build from the verified Sprint 4 baseline (v4.5.0-baseline).
Key objectives include the new Workflow module, restored TypeScript strict typing, crypto security utilities, and expanded test coverage.

Reference issue: Sprint 5 Regeneration  Workflow Module + TypeScript + Crypto Reintegration

 What Was Added

 Workflow Model + API

Added Workflow model and Prisma migration.

Implemented API routes /api/workflows and /api/workflows/[id].

Updated seed script with sample workflow data.

 TypeScript Strict Mode

Re-enabled tsconfig.json strict rules.

Resolved type errors across API and test layers.

 Crypto Layer

Restored src/lib/crypto.ts for AES-256-GCM encryption/decryption.

Integrated with NEXTAUTH_SECRET.

 Testing

Added Playwright E2E tests for auth, theme toggle, connections, and workflows.

Added integration tests for API routes (Vitest or Jest).

 Docs and Config

Added prisma.config.ts, updated README.md.

Confirmed .env variable usage and security.

 Environment

WSL 2 (Ubuntu 22.04)

Node 22 / npm 10.9.4 ( 11.6.2 optional)

PostgreSQL 15

Prisma 6.17+

Next.js 13 / TypeScript strict mode

Setup reference: doc/WSL_Setup_for_Codex_Rebuild.md

Category	Command / Verification	Status

Migrations	npx prisma migrate reset + seed works correctly	
TypeScript	npx tsc --noEmit  0 errors	
Tests	npx playwright test  all pass	
Crypto	crypto.ts encrypts/decrypts sample data	
Manual UI	Workflow CRUD works via browser	
Docs	README.md updated with seed + test instructions	
Lint / Formatting	npm run lint clean	
Tag	v5.0.0-codex-verified created after merge	
 Notes for Reviewers

Database seeding verified for SQLite (dev) and Postgres (local).

All sensitive keys use .env values  no hardcoded secrets.

Workflow logic mirrors Sprint 4 patterns for connections and auth.

 Next Steps

 Approve and merge into main.

 Push tag v5.0.0-codex-verified.

 Close linked issue Codex Sprint 5 Regeneration Request.

End of Template

pull_requests.title: Codex: Run Minimal Sprint-5 Harness & Stabilize Server Boot
pull_requests.body:
Codex: Run Minimal Sprint-5 Harness & Stabilize Server Boot

Objective:
Run the current sprint-5-testing-v2 branch of garybayes/saas-app and stabilize the Playwright test infrastructure.

We are beginning Sprint 5 testing, but want to ensure:

Next.js server starts reliably

race conditions are resolved

login + middleware + theme cookies behave predictably

Playwrights webServer startup timing is consistent

redirects are handled correctly

base URL and port reuse are stable


Before generating the full E2E suite, we want the foundation locked down.

We already have a 100% clean Sprint-4 baseline, and only minimal Playwright tests currently exist:

tests/e2e/login.spec.ts
tests/e2e/signup.spec.ts

Both pass locally.

Tasks for Codex

Please perform the following on the branch sprint-5-testing-v2:


---

1. Fresh checkout + run minimal E2E tests

npm ci
npm run build
npm run test:e2e

Capture:

logs

server startup behavior

Playwright worker boot

any warnings

any port-detection issues

any async cookie/middleware timing issues



---

2. Fix all server startup and race conditions

This includes:

A. webServer stability

Ensure:

webServer: {
  command: "npm run build && npm start",
  url: "http://localhost:3000",
  reuseExistingServer: !process.env.CI,
  timeout: 120 * 1000,
}

Test:

no hanging

no redirect loops

no port in use fallback to 3001

no timed out waiting for server


B. Fix Next.js 15 middleware timing issues

Stabilize:

getServerSession() call timing

NextAuth redirect flow

CSRF token hydration

theme cookie read sequence

preload script ordering


C. Fix load-race during login

Detect and patch:

input field clearing

screen frozen after login

hydration mismatch

theme flicker on first render


This requires a fix in middleware + login page + preload ordering.


---

3. Fix all test flakiness

Create patches for:

auth fixtures

guest fixtures

login helpers

extra waits

route stabilization


Ensure:

Login page loads
Signup page loads

are perfectly stable across 10 consecutive runs.


---

4. Remove dead test folders

Delete:

tests/e2e/private
tests/e2e/public
tests/utils/*

Keep only:

tests/e2e/login.spec.ts
tests/e2e/signup.spec.ts
tests/utils/constants.ts

Ensure Playwrights config excludes all legacy directories.


---

5. Output patch set

Please generate a single combined diff containing all changes:

playwright.config.ts

middleware.ts

layout.tsx

login/page.tsx

theme-preload.ts

any required server-boot stabilization

test fixtures

test config



---

6. Provide a concise report

Include:

root cause summary

server startup improvements

Playwright timing improvements

final clean tree structure

instructions for merging into main



---

Codex Inputs

Repository:
https://github.com/garybayes/saas-app

Branch to operate on:
sprint-5-testing-v2

pull_requests.title: Sprint 5 testing
pull_requests.body:
Pull Request: Sprint 5 Testing & Integration Rebuild (with Patch 1 Corrections)

This PR delivers the complete Sprint 5 mandate:

  • Full rebuild of all testing infrastructure (unit, integration, E2E)

  • Stabilized authentication, theme persistence, and protected routing tests

  • Clean separation of public vs private routes

  • Automated Codex-compliant structure for future sprints

This PR includes Sprint 5 Patch 1 corrections to the specification (see below).

Codex should consume this PR description as the authoritative specification for Sprint 5.

Sprint 5 Goals

  1. Rebuild the entire testing suite (unit, integration, e2e) from scratch.

  2. Validate all authentication and authorization flows.

  3. Validate theme persistence across login, logout, signup, redirects, and refresh.

  4. Validate all protected routes and public routes.

  5. Ensure middleware behavior matches the spec exactly.

  6. Establish stable, deterministic Playwright tests with consistent fixtures.

  7. Add integration tests for API endpoints (settings, connections, profile, theme).

  8. Remove legacy or obsolete tests from earlier unstable sprints.

  9. Restore a clean, maintainable, deterministic CI pipeline for future sprints.

Sprint 5 Patch 1 (Corrections to Specification)

These corrections must override any previously implied behavior:

1. Default user theme after signup = "light"

  • All new users must be initialized with "light" in the database.

  • E2E tests must enforce this.

  • Signup Auto-login Dashboard must show "light" UI.

2. Authenticated user access to /signup redirect to /dashboard

  • This mirrors the existing rule for /login.

  • Must be enforced by middleware.

  • Must be covered by both integration + E2E tests.

3. No further corrections added in Patch 1.

(Any later corrections will be introduced as Patch 2.)

Functional Requirements for Sprint 5

Authentication

  • Login with valid credentials redirects to /dashboard.

  • Login with invalid credentials shows error and stays on /login.

  • Signup with valid data:

    • Creates user in DB

    • Default theme = "light"

    • Auto-login succeeds

    • Redirect to /connections

  • Incorrect signup fields produce validation errors.

Protected Routing

Middleware rules:

Condition | Behavior -- | -- Unauthenticated private route | redirect to /login Authenticated /login | redirect /dashboard Authenticated /signup | redirect /dashboard Authenticated private route | allow Unauthenticated /login or /signup | allow Unauthenticated unknown route | 404 stays 404

E2E tests must confirm:

  • No regressions in theme propagation

  • DB updates instantly

  • UI renders theme consistently across navigations

Connections Tests

  • GET /api/connections returns only user-owned connections

  • Empty state on new users

  • UI renders list

  • Error handling tested

Profile & Theme API Tests

  • GET /settings/profile returns email, displayName, theme

  • PATCH /settings/profile updates fields

  • PATCH /settings/theme updates DB and returns expected output

Testing Requirements

Integration Tests

Include but not limited to:

  • /api/auth/signup

  • /api/settings/profile

  • /api/settings/theme

  • /api/connections

  • /api/connections/[id]

  • Protected routes: validation & rejection logic

  • Middleware simulation tests

E2E Tests

Using Playwright:

Public Flows

  • Login

  • Signup

  • Redirects

  • Error handling

Private Flows

  • Dashboard

  • Settings (profile + theme)

  • Connections

  • Theme propagation

  • Theme persistence

  • Auto-login after signup

Technical Requirements

  • Fully deterministic tests (no race conditions)

  • No reliance on prior state (fresh DB per test suite)

  • Use tests/setup/globalSetup.ts with seed users

  • Remove old .auth/state.json

  • Use fixtures for authenticated sessions

  • All tests must pass on GitHub Actions CI

Cleanup Requirements

Codex should also:

  • Remove legacy debug routes unless explicitly listed under /api/_debug

  • Ensure test setup does not mutate production .env.local

  • Ensure no test-generated junk files persist across runs

  • Verify tsconfig & ESLint remain aligned with Next.js 15 & Playwright

Expected Outcome

After Sprint 5 completes:

  • App behavior will be fully validated by a deterministic, modern test suite.

  • All routes, themes, and auth flows will be confidently stable.

  • Sprint 6 and later sprints can proceed without inherited instability.

Codex: Begin Work on Sprint 5

This PR is ready for Codex to execute end-to-end.
